compositeArtefactDescription.compositeArtefactDes: Vākūr (Pākūr) plates, time of Nṛpatuṅgavarman, year 8

copperplateFormat.bindingInfo: Found without ring. The whole piercing the plates is 0.135 cm in diameter and is found at 0.9 to 1 cm from the left vertical side.

compositeArtefactHistory.p: Discovered by Jules Delafon, in June 1879, buried at a depth of 1 metre, in the middle of a brick structure, 6 metres south of the Vākūr temple. Given by Jules Godin to Jules Ferry. Lost of sight until December 1904. Given by Madame Jules Ferry to the future BnF.
